direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are fundamental for object comparison and hash-based collections, sharing similar control flow and exception handling.
Both methods involve deep copying or comparison of object states, ensuring integrity and consistency.
Both methods modify the internal state of the object, preparing it for comparison or other operations.
Both methods handle attribute management, ensuring uniqueness or equality based on specific criteria.
Both methods manage exceptions related to serialization and comparison, ensuring robust operation.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing attributes before comparison ensures a consistent state for the equals method.
Normalizing attributes before comparison ensures that the comparison is case-insensitive and consistent.
Verifying equality after the equals method invocation ensures that the comparison logic is correct and handles exceptions appropriately.
